channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title:
投资大宗商品变得异常困难。
投资者必须应对政治和技术方面的一系列不确定性--重要的不仅是西方的政策和需求👇。
item.description:
Investing in commodities has become nightmarishly difficult.

Investors have to contend with a barrage of political and technological uncertainties—and it is not only Western policies and demand that matter econ.st/49cVYf4 👇

item.title: 战争和冲突进一步削弱了2023年的全球民主。在我们的姊妹公司 @TheEIU 对 167 个国家进行的排名中，平均得分为 5.23 分（满分 10 分），是该指数开始以来的最低分👇。
item.description: War and conflict further undermined global democracy in 2023. The average score of 5.23 out of ten in a ranking of 167 countries by @TheEIU, our sister company, is the lowest since the index began econ.st/49vk1Wc 👇

item.title: 今天的 "情报 "节目：纳瓦尔尼之后的俄罗斯反对派、英国对电动汽车的需求放缓、《肖申克的救赎》在中国上映。收听每日播客： 🎧
item.description: Today on “The Intelligence”: opposition in Russia after Navalny, Britain’s slowing demand for electric cars, and “The Shawshank Redemption” hits the stage in China. Listen to the daily podcast: econ.st/49mFUaI 🎧

item.title: 想为《经济学人》撰写关于中国的文章？我们正在招聘一名驻华记者 👇
item.description: Want to write about China for The Economist? We are hiring a correspondent to focus on the country econ.st/3SCnqf2 👇

item.title:
为失职的金融工具辩护。
尽管通胀保值债券并不总能抵御通胀，但它确实有更广泛的用途 👇
item.description:
In defence of a financial instrument that fails to do its job.

Although they do not always protect against inflation, inflation-protected bonds do serve a wider purpose econ.st/3T2sIkz 👇

item.title: 未来的追求者们正在向派拉蒙招手。该剧凸显了娱乐业的悲惨现状👇。
item.description: Would-be suitors are wooing Paramount. The drama highlights the sorry state of the entertainment industry econ.st/3SYienc 👇

item.title:
经济脱碳需要大量的金属，但矿业公司却不愿放松银根。
了解他们不愿投资的原因，以及如何才能让他们投资： 👇
item.description:
Vast amounts of metal are required to decarbonise the economy, but mining firms are reluctant to loosen their purse-strings.

Find out why they are reluctant to invest—and what it will take to get them to dig in: econ.st/3I3wmW1 👇

item.title: 胡塞武装的宗教领袖阿卜杜勒-马利克-胡塞（Abdel-Malik al-Houthi）发誓要继续袭击船只，直到以色列停止轰炸加沙并允许不受限制的援助进入。也门组织欣喜于来自国外的鼓励，但很少有人注意到它在国内对人性的蔑视
item.description: The Houthis’ religious leader, Abdel­-Malik al-Houthi, vows to continue attacks on ships until Israel stops bombing Gaza and lets in unfettered aid. The Yemeni group rejoices in encouragement from abroad, but few notice its disdain for humanity at home econ.st/3wrNO3P

item.title:
种族隔离后的南非常常因其自由公正的选举而备受赞誉。
但是，由于非洲人国民大会的统治地位，这些选举的结果一直都是预料之中的。直到现在 👇
item.description:
Post­-apartheid South Africa is often lauded for its free and fair elections.

But such is the dominance of the African National Congress that the results of those elections have always been foregone concusions. Until now econ.st/49xHIgA 👇

item.title:
问题不仅在于美国是否会放弃乌克兰，还在于美国是否会放弃欧洲。
请阅读唐纳德-特朗普可能重新上台的阴影如何笼罩着欧盟国家： 👇
item.description:
The question is not just whether America will abandon Ukraine, but whether it might abandon Europe.

Read how the spectre of Donald Trump’s possible return to office is looming over EU states: econ.st/3wiwEWl 👇

item.title:
匈牙利是全球重塑右翼政治运动的中心。
维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）所信奉的民族保守主义与罗纳德-里根（Ronald Reagan）和玛格丽特-撒切尔（Margaret Thatcher）时代的民族保守主义截然不同。
item.description:
Hungary is at the heart of a global movement to reinvent right-wing politics.

National conservatism, espoused by Viktor Orban, marks a radical departure from the sort that prevailed in the era of Ronald Reagan and Margaret Thatcher econ.st/48mPLvI 👇

item.title: 公开来源的调查人员说，越来越多的证据表明，一小队乌克兰特种部队正在苏丹作战。我们将解释他们可能在那里做什么 👇。
item.description: Accumulating evidence suggests that a small team of Ukrainian special forces is fighting in Sudan, open-source investigators say. We explain what they might be doing there econ.st/3OLqLYk 👇

item.title: 低价产品和营销手段正在吸引点击。亚马逊该如何担心Shein和Temu？ 👇
item.description: Dirt-cheap products and marketing splurges are catching clicks. How worried should Amazon be about Shein and Temu? econ.st/4bCXqcl 👇

item.title: 绿色工业是最大的气候难题。电气化长期以来一直被忽视，但它能成为解决方案吗？ 👇
item.description: Greening industry is the biggest climate conundrum. Electrification has been long overlooked, but could it be the solution? econ.st/3SKpgKW 👇

item.title: 在国家保守派眼中，西方并不是山顶上的光辉城市，而是衰落前的罗马--颓废、堕落，即将在野蛮人的入侵中崩溃。他们不满足于抵制进步，还想摧毁古典自由主义
item.description: National conservatives do not see the West as the shining city on the hill, but as Rome before the fall—decadent, depraved and about to collapse amid a barbarian invasion. Not content with resisting progress, they also want to destroy classical liberalism econ.st/3I45zc4

item.title: 强烈的异议不足以阻止弗拉基米尔-普京再次 "当选 "六年总统。而随着即将到来的投票结束，这位俄罗斯领导人将有更大的自由来进一步升级他的镇压运动👇。
item.description: A powerful showing of dissent will not be enough to prevent Vladimir Putin’s “election” to another six years in office. And with the upcoming vote behind him, the Russian leader will have a freer hand to further escalate his campaign of repression econ.st/49kBIYW 👇

item.title: 亲吻表妹真的可以吗？肯塔基州最近发生的一场争论表明，表兄妹结婚的法律可能要过很长时间才能被废除 ⬇️
item.description: Is it really OK to kiss your cousin? A recent controversy in Kentucky suggests it will probably be a long time before cousin-marriage laws are stricken from the books econ.st/49eDP0D ⬇️

item.title: 日本半导体工具制造商蓬勃发展
item.description: Japan’s semiconductor toolmakers are booming econ.st/3T0AKeT

item.title: 佛罗伦萨的一间密室藏有米开朗基罗的画作
item.description: A secret room in Florence boasts drawings by Michelangelo econ.st/3I2xtW2

item.title: 真的应该阻止日本买家收购美国钢铁公司吗？这场风波揭示了国家安全的新内涵 👇
item.description: Should a Japanese buyer really be blocked from acquiring US Steel? The row reveals the new meaning of national security econ.st/3UHvDBk 👇

item.title: 商品交易从来都不简单：价格取决于不可预测的经济周期，以及钻探者、种植者和采矿者的生产能力。但现在，这已成为梦魇👇。
item.description: Commodity trading has never been simple: prices depend on unpredictable economic cycles, as well as the production capacity of drillers, growers and miners. But it is now nightmarish econ.st/49j6DVu 👇

item.title:
乌克兰是欧洲仅次于俄罗斯的第二大天然气储存国，天然气储存总量接近 330 亿立方米。这些设施大大超出了乌克兰国内的需求。
欧盟和乌克兰政府都希望这些设施能够发挥作用 👇
item.description:
Ukraine is home to Europe’s second-largest gas-storage capacity, after Russia, totalling nearly 33bn cubic metres. The facilities massively exceed the country’s domestic needs.

Both the EU and the Ukrainian government are keen to put them to work econ.st/3SFMvGg 👇

item.title: 经过 21 个月的中断，非洲各国政府正在试探性地重返国际债券市场。债务忧虑稍有缓解，但借贷仍然昂贵 👇
item.description: After a 21-month hiatus, African governments are tentatively returning to international bond markets. Debt worries have eased a little, but borrowing is still expensive econ.st/3uypEEv 👇

item.title: 金斯伍德和威灵伯勒的选举结果虽然可怕，但对英国保守党来说却比想象的还要糟糕。工党最近在特别选举中的失利似乎是家常便饭。其实不然 👇
item.description: Terrible as they are, the results from Kingswood and Wellingborough are even worse for Britain’s Tories than they might seem. Labour has recently made upsets in special elections seem routine. They are not econ.st/3ONzWaG 👇

item.title:
拥抱可爱的霍比特人和少年英雄，软化了意大利后法西斯主义的边缘，就像乔治亚-梅洛尼自传中的喷绘肖像一样有效。
@john_hooper 发现，曾经的特立独行如今已成为无价的宣传品。
item.description:
Embracing cuddly hobbits and boy heroes softens the edges of Italian post-fascism as effectively as the airbrushed portraits of Giorgia Meloni in her autobiography.

@john_hooper discovers how what was once an idiosyncrasy is now invaluable propaganda econ.st/3SK07A4

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普威胁北约，波罗的海国家加强防御
item.description: As Donald Trump threatens NATO, the Baltic states stiffen their defences econ.st/3HZnXTy

item.title: 如何避免即将到来的欧盟领导层改组失败
item.description: How not to botch the upcoming EU leadership reshuffle econ.st/3OJnBnQ

item.title: 欧盟 "covid-19 "恢复基金三年来的情况 ⬇️
item.description: What to make of the EU’s covid-19 recovery fund, three years on econ.st/49iGnuD ⬇️

item.title: 停止思考你的下一个观点，倾听别人的观点。这就是如何从工作中的对话中获益 👇
item.description: Stop thinking about your next point and listen to the one being made. This is how to benefit from the conversations you have at work econ.st/3UFEJP1 👇

item.title: 据一家智囊团称，从现在到 2050 年，全球经济脱碳将需要 65 亿吨金属。这将需要大量的爆破和钻探，而现在就必须开始。为什么还没有开始？ 👇
item.description: Decarbonising the global economy will require 6.5bn tonnes of metal between now and 2050, according to a think-tank. That will require a lot of blasting and drilling, which must begin now. Why isn’t it happening? econ.st/49kPKty 👇
